metadata.title: Rick & Morty CoQUI TTS Explanation Reel

audio_sequence.text: Aw geez Rick, what's TTS? And why do you keep saying 'CoQUI' like that?
TTS means Text-To-Speech, Morty! CoQUI TTS can clone ANY voice from just a few seconds of audio!
It's like having a voice synthesizer that can sound like anyone!
Wait, so you're telling me it can make ANY voice say ANYTHING? That sounds kinda creepy, Rick...
Exactly! But Morty, it's not just creepy - it's REVOLUTIONARY!
Think about it: you could have Einstein explain quantum physics in his own voice, or hear Shakespeare read his own plays!
Wow Rick, that's actually pretty cool! So it's like... voice time travel?
Voice time travel! I like that, Morty! But wait, there's more!
CoQUI TTS can also fine-tune models for specific voices, languages, and even emotions!
Fine-tune? What does that mean, Rick?
Fine-tuning means you can train the model on specific data to make it even better!
Want a voice that sounds exactly like your grandma? Fine-tune it on her voice recordings!
That's amazing! But Rick, what about different languages? Can it do that too?
Absolutely, Morty! CoQUI TTS supports multiple languages and can even do cross-language voice cloning!
Clone a voice in English and make it speak Spanish!
This is getting really impressive! So it's like the ultimate voice tool?
Exactly! And it's all open-source, Morty!
Anyone can use it, modify it, and contribute to making it even better!
